event.name: START_ORIGINS
event.text: You've arrived at the original Crystal Homeworlds, and already you can see the aftermath of the brutal invasion of tourists and "pioneers". The skeletons of Crystal structures dot the surface of the planet of which the entry beacon is concerningly close...

event.name: START_ORIGINS_RUWEN
event.text:
You've arrived at the original Crystal Homeworlds, and already you can see the aftermath of the brutal invasion of tourists and "pioneers". The skeletons of Crystal structures dot the surface of the planet of which the entry beacon is concerningly close...
NOTE FROM THE DEVS: This sector/questline is in a transitional period. Certain elements/dialogue might not make sense. It will be redone in a later (but hopefully soon) update. The current questline/unlock however should at least be functional as they were before for the time being.

event.name: START_ORIGINS_RUWEN_2
event.text: Ruwen explains to you the situation. The item you're looking for is the Waystone Key, a device used to activate or shut down the old waystone. The Crystals need it back so they can activate the new waystone that they are constructing. He transfers the co-ordinates to your ship.

event.name: GUARD_CULTIST
event.text: A strange vessel in Crystalline and regal gold colors is guarding the beacon. It appears to be... of Rock design? You've never seen a ship like this before...

The ship moves closer, enough for you to make out the logo of a burning Crystal on the ship's hull. You receive a hail from a burly Rockman decorated in stylish blue robes with golden decals lining the hood and sleeves. His face bears the frown of a man not happy to see another ship in his territory.

"You! An outsider? Have you come for riches? Fame? A nice relaxing vacation here in paradise? Well get lost, you aren't gettin' none of that! This sector belongs to the Cult of the Eternal Flame now! You ain't welcome here, unless you bear the mark of the Ember!"
The cultist grumbles. "Nevermind it, you won't be alive for long."

choice.text: (Vortigon) This vessel has permission from the Grand Priest to travel here.

event.text: The Cultists pause, and quickly apologize. Terrified of Vortigon's wrath, they hand over some supplies and beg for forgiveness.

choice.text: (Cultist Crew) Show them proof of your loyalty.

event.text: The cultist gives a large, hearty laugh. "Hah! Brother, it is good to see you. How have you been? It has been so long since I have seen you, I thought you had died. So few of us have left this sector in such a long time... maybe I shall come with you so I can hear the tales of your travels."

"Gasp! An Ember, you are one of those who paved the very infrastructure for which this sector was constructed from! I thought you had left us mortals behind in your Exodus from this territory. Oh heavens be, please grant me passage on your vessel."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_CULTIST_REVISIT
event.text: It seems they've since replaced the guard from your last visit, but the model is the same. The Cultist hails you, and begins a monologue similar to last time.

choice.text: Yeah yeah yeah, we've heard this all before.

event.text: "You... what? Then you will already know that you need to bear the mark of the Ember if you wish to leave here alive!"

choice.text: Nah, we'll just blow our way through.

event.text: You mute the Cultist ship and attack.

choice.text: (Vortigon) This vessel has permission from the Grand Priest to travel here.

event.text: The Cultists pause, and quickly apologize. Terrified of Vortigon's wrath, they hand over some supplies and beg for forgiveness.

choice.text: (Cultist Crew) Show them proof of your loyalty.

So few of us have left this sector in such a long time... maybe I shall come with you so I can hear the tales of your travels."

"Gasp! An Ember, you are one of those who paved the very infrastructure for which this sector was constructed from! I thought you had left us mortals behind in your Exodus from this territory. Oh heavens be, please grant me passage on your vessel."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_CULTIST_BOARDERS
event.text: As the cultist guard sputters, you detect a distress signal coming from their ship. However, no ASB appears due to how close you are to the planet's surface. Instead, several cultists are beamed aboard!

event.name: GUARD_CULTIST_DESTROY
event.text: The Cultist guard has been eliminated, but you're certain that there are plenty more to come in this sector.

event.name: GUARD_CULTIST_DEADCREW
event.text: The Cultist guard has been eliminated, but you're certain that there are plenty more to come in this sector. Fortunately, it appears their cargo survived the fight.

event.name: GUARD_CULTIST_FOLLOWUP
event.text: If there was any hope of getting through the sector unnoticed, you've botched it. They will no doubt send reinforcements to hunt you down.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_CULTIST

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: As you expected, a Cultist vessel approaches to avenge their dead guard, with their weapons armed and their captain very displeased.

event.name: ORIGINS_EXIT
event.text: You have arrived at the exit beacon. It appears the apparatus will deposit you in a random sector once we jump away.

event.name: ORIGINS_RUWEN_EXIT
event.text: You have arrived at the exit beacon. It appears the apparatus will deposit you in a random sector once we jump away.
The Rebel fleet has taken control of the beacon! You'll have to fight your way out!

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Try to escape the Elite.

event.text: The crystalline tech that makes up the device is fascinating, if not completely foreign to you.
Ruwen is gleeful, very pleased with this outcome. "Good, good! This is most excellent."

Ruwen takes a glance at Vortigon, who is snoring away in a corner of the ship nearby. Suddenly, Ruwen lifts up the key and smashes it against the ground of the ship. "I... I have decided that it is best I do not return this to my people. You, despite not needing to in any capacity, decided to show this man mercy and even convince him to join your ranks. Any doubts I had about you have been assuaged. It will be an honor to continue to serve under your command. I suppose this reward is worthy of you, even if the original mission is obsolete."
"You have my thanks, captain. I'm afraid I must now return to my people with this tech. But let me not forget to pay you for your help!"

removeCrew.text: You cannot clone Ruwen as he is not dead. He probably wouldn't be very pleased with it either.

event.text: Unfortunately, Ruwen is no longer with you. With no proper way to return the device back to the Crystal people now, you break it down into scrap.
Unfortunately, it seems you did not obtain the Waystone key... that was the whole reason you came here, was it not?

Ruwen looks very disappointed. "You had one task... I... I suppose we will have to reconstruct a new one. That tech was ancient, and it'll be hard to replicate it. I'm afraid I can stay with you no longer. I must return to my people now, and give them the bad news. Though it may be ironic, but I have one last favor to ask of you..."
"Never return to our sectors again." With that, Ruwen moves to pack up his things and depart once you leave the sector.

removeCrew.text: You cannot clone Ruwen as he is not dead. He probably wouldn't be very pleased with it either.

event.text: Either way, Ruwen is no longer with us. You can consider this mission a total failure, but at least you got to see some new sights.

event.name: CULTIST_CHURCH_FAKE
event.text: You've stumbled across a massive church at this beacon.
It seems most of the church has been abandoned since you were last here. They probably relocated to another place since then...
It's quite the spectacle, but there's little for you to do here.

event.name: CULTIST_CHURCH_RUWEN

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the Waystone Key.

event.text: You've arrived at the co-ordinates specified by Ruwen.
You're surprised to see it's the same church as before. Ruwen is as confused as you are as to why the co-ordinates led you here though, but he suggests that we enter and investigate.
The location appears to be home to a massive church. Ruwen is as confused as you are as to why the co-ordinates led you here though, but he suggests that we enter and investigate.

event.name: CULTIST_CHURCH_BEGIN
event.text: You enter the church to find a Rockman clad in a red robe preaching to crowds of Cultists. They're in the middle of a sermon, and they probably won't appreciate an interruption. However, from the looks of it, it doesn't seem they'll be winding down any time soon.

choice.text: This is important; interrupt the sermon.

event.text: You stand up and approach the preacher. He doesn't look pleased.
Ruwen outreaches his hand, but the Rockman won't shake it. "I am Grand Priest Vortigon, and this is my church. For what reason have you deemed it necessary to barge in and interrupt my preaching?"

choice.text: We've come for the Waystone Key.

event.choice:
> Just stand there and stare.
Without Ruwen you have no idea what to say. For a few awkward moments you stand there staring until the Rockman gets tired and orders three of his guards to come and carry you out. You run out of the church with the cultists in pursuit.

choice.text: Attempt to sneak around and look for the key.

event.text: You exit the church and loop around back. You notice two doors, but you have no idea where it might be.
You make a random guess and pick the shrine. As you suspected, Ruwen spots the key resting on a pedestal protected by a small glass box.
You smash the case, only for the pedestal to rapidly recede into the floor and an alarm to blare. You hear shouts from the other room and run out, pursued by enraged several cultists.
As you're getting back to the ship, you spot Vortigon and a group of several other cultists running towards a massive cruiser. It looks like Vortigon is carrying the key with him!
You speed towards the gigantic cruiser, weapons charging.
You have enough problems to deal with, like the hordes of Cultists swarming to attack your ship.

You enter the storage room, and begin to pilfer through the junk. You find plenty of junk, but not the key. You start to consider looping back and checking out the shrine when several cultists enter the room and spot you looting their junk. Reasonably displeased with you looting their junk, they chase you back to the ship!

event.name: CULTIST_CHURCH_QUESTION
event.text: "The... what?" Vortigon looks confused, so Ruwen steps in again and explains the device. "Are you referring to the Eternal Ember? This is our most sacred possession! Of course you may not have it! Now get out of my church."

You push past Vortigon and prepare to march to take the key before you realize... you have absolutely no idea where it is. Vortigon coughs, then orders his guards to chase you off. Crap, mission abort!

choice.text: Leave, then sneak around back and look for the key.

event.text: You exit the church and loop around back. You notice two doors where it could be.

You recall Vortigon saying the 'key' is the basis of their entire cult, so you figure the shrine is a good place to look. As you suspected, Ruwen spots the key resting on a pedestal protected by a small glass box.
You smash the case, only for the pedestal to rapidly recede into the floor and an alarm to blare. You hear shouts from the other room and run out, pursued by enraged several cultists.
As you're getting back to the ship, you spot Vortigon and a group of several other cultists running towards a massive cruiser. It looks like Vortigon is carrying the key with him!
You speed towards the gigantic cruiser, weapons charging.
You have enough problems to deal with, like the hordes of Cultists swarming to attack your ship.

You enter the storage room, and begin to pilfer through the junk. You find plenty of junk, but not the key. You start to consider looping back and checking out the shrine when several cultists enter the room and spot you looting their junk. Reasonably displeased with you looting their junk, they chase you back to the ship!

gotaway.text: Vortigon's cruiser jumps away, leaving you behind in the dust. Damn it! There'll be no way to get the Key now...

event.name: VORTIGON_DESTROY
event.text: Vortigon's ship explodes, sending debris scattering down onto the church. You swoop in to collect some material before leaving - disappointed that the Key was destroyed along with the cruiser.

event.name: VORTIGON_SURRENDER
event.text: Vortigon's cruiser stutters, barely able to keep on track. They won't survive long.
Vortigon appears on the vidscreen, with bits of damaged electrical equipment sparking behind him. "We will never surrender, bastards! Go to hell!" He shuts off his communicator.
You power down your weapons and watch. A massive explosion destroys the cruiser's engines, and the ship plummets into the ground. You pilot down near it, surveying the wreckage.
You enter the wreckage, careful not to step on any broken glass or corpses. You spot the Key, mostly undamaged, in a corner of the ship.

event.name: VORTIGON_DEADCREW
event.text: You've emptied Vortigon's cruiser of crew. What remains of the ship makes easy pickings.

event.name: VORTIGON_KEY
event.text: You scoop up the Key off the floor of the ship. At last, you have what you came for.
As you leave, you notice the noise of a man gasping for air. You turn to see Vortigon, barely clinging to life, crawling away from you in fear.
You lift up your boot, and slam it down on Vortigon. In an instant, he is gone. That bastard got what he deserved.

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Hurry to the Medbay and heal him.

event.text: You lift up Vortigon and carry him towards the Medbay. You're just fast enough to save him.

choice.text: (Clone Bay) Enter Vortigon's data into the Clone Bay.

event.text: You take a swab of Vortigon's DNA and encode it into the Clone Bay registry...

event.name: VORTIGON_SAVED
event.text: In a little while Vortigon wakes up. "You... you saved me? Are you mentally ill? You attacked my church to try and steal the sacred Eternal Ember, and you have the audacity to spare my life? I-thank you?"

event.name: ORIGINS_FREECREW
event.text: You're surprised to find a burnt civilian ship drifting nearby. It appears they were tourists attacked by the Cultists, and few survived. You welcome one of their remaining crew aboard.

event.name: CULTIST_MOURNING
event.text: A group of somber ships have gathered on the surface of a nearby planet. It looks as if they are in the middle of some sort of funeral.

choice.text: Sneak into the crowds and see if you can try and pilfer some stuff.

event.text: You land on the planet and sneak through the crowds of Cultists. However, one individual spots you and points you out. "Hey you, where are your robes? Are you supposed to be here?"
"Is that so? What is the name of our friend whom we have gathered here to honor?"
Your Slug, being telepathic, knows the answer by reading it from the minds of the other cultists nearby.
Your Shell, being now blessed with the gift of telepathy, knows the answer by reading it from the minds of the other cultists nearby.

"Ah, brother, my mistake! I did not recognize you amongst all of your strange friends. Have a nice day!" You continue on and find a spot with several unprotected cultist ships, which you raid for supplies before heading back to the ship.

"Oh heavens, Vortigon! My-my apologies!" All of the nearby cultists take a step back, shocked to see their leader with you. Not long after they're showering you with gifts, praising Vortigon and his 'friends.'
You run back to the ship and fly away before the confused cultists can do anything.
It's best not to go diving into the depths of a planet swarming with so many Cultists.

event.name: CULTIST_MOURNING_INCORRECT
event.text: "That is not his name! You are an impostor!" You run back to the ship, with several angry cultists and a hostile ship in pursuit.

event.name: CULTIST_MOURNING_CORRECT
event.text: "Oh... er yes, that is correct. My apologies." You continue on and find a spot with several unprotected cultist ships, which you raid for supplies before heading back to the ship.

event.name: CULTIST_BLESSED_WEAPON
event.text: A small market nearby is under operation by Cultists. They claim to be selling "blessed" weapons, though they appear to just be regular Crystal weapons to you.
Blessed or not, you decide these weapons won't be useful for your mission.

event.name: CULTIST_GASPLANET
event.text: You notice several cultist ships surrounding a gas planet. You catch chatter among them. "Yeah, boss said to build a temple somewhere 'round here. But uh... how?"

choice.text: Explain to them that what they're trying to do is impossible.

event.text: You try to explain, but the Cultists merely insult your intelligence. "Nah, you have no idea what you're talking about! Leave this kind of stuff to the smart ones like us, ok?"

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Have your Engineer help them.

event.text: Your Engineer grumbles, not happy to be working with xenos. Still, they agree and offer assistance to the cultists. A little while later, they've drawn out designs for a floating temple idea. The cultists seem pleased and pay you in thanks.

choice.text: Scam them into buying some junk from you.

event.text: You wave some junk in front of the camera, claiming that it's a special lightweight material that'll float over the planet. It's a total lie, but the idiot Rockmen seem to believe it. They pay you well for the 'miracle metal'.
You have faith that they'll figure out that their mission is impossible eventually.

event.name: CULTIST_ARGUMENT
event.text: Two Cultist ships appear to be in an argument nearby, though you can't tell what.

You move closer and listen. "I'm telling you, it says Amber not Ember! Look here, right in Rebirth 15:6!" "No, that is a typo! You think we would have gone through such trouble to name ourselves the 'Cult of the Eternal Ember' if it was actually meant to be Amber?"

"Hah, a typo you say? It is clear that it was meant to be Amber. Look at our Grand Priest's ship; it is the color of Amber!" "You are a fool! Amber is not red, Amber is orange! You must be colorblind, you idiot!"

You listen to the Cultists argue back and forth for a while longer, fascinated by their conversation. However, at long last they notice you. "Gah, how long have you been listening? Bah, nevermind it. Surely you've heard both of our points, so tell us what you think is correct!"
The second Cultist pouts, complaining that your voice has no say in the matter, but the other ship doesn't care. They thank you for helping taking their side and give you some supplies.

choice.text: The Cult was meant to be named after the Eternal "Amber".

event.text: The first Cultist pouts, complaining that your voice has no say in the matter, but the second ship doesn't care. They thank you for helping taking their side and give you some supplies.

choice.text: This is taking too long. Leave.
This doesn't pertain to us, leave.

event.text: You ignore the two ships.

textList.name: TEXT_ORIGINS_ATTACKERS
textList.text: A nearby planet still hosting several Crystalline people appears to be under attack!
A Crystalline vessel is the source of this distress beacon. It appears they're under attack!
A Crystal ship hails you, requesting that you protect them from a hostile ship that has been following them.

event.text: You distance yourself from the source of the distress beacon.
It appears the attacker is a cultist vessel. You prepare to attack.
It appears the attacker is a pirate vessel. You prepare to attack.
It appears the attacker is a Rebel vessel. You prepare to attack.

event.name: ORIGINS_ATTACKERS_WIN
event.text: The vessel has been defeated. You scrap the salvage left behind from the fight.
The Crystals thank you and pay you some scrap.
The Crystalline ship is badly damaged. One of the few survivors requests to join your crew.

event.name: ORIGINS_REBEL_CHASE
event.text: You notice a Rebel ship nearby, but they don't stick around for long until a Cultist vessel jumps in mere seconds later and chases them off!
You chase down the cultist vessel.
You chase down the Rebel vessel.
Not too long after the ships disappear from your view.
Almost immediately, the Rebel ship jumps away. Cowards...

The Rebel captain thanks you. "I never should have joined these orange-uniformed twats. Last thing I expected was for command to send me searching for a freakin' Multiverse Renegade in a Cultist infested craphole. Mind if I come with you?"

The Rebel captain thanks you. "Now, don't think this is because I like you, but a favor is a favor and I owe one to you. Command won't notice if I happen to give them the wrong info on your location..."
The Cultist captain glares at you. "Mind your own business, Feds! This is our sector, and we don't want your help."
The Cultist thanks you gruffly. "Ugh, fine. Take this scrap and get lost."
The Cultist thanks you gruffly. "Ugh, fine. Take this scrap and get lost."

event.name: ORIGINS_PIRATE_RAIDERS
event.text: You spot several pirates raiding the remains of a Crystalline settlement.
You engage the pirate vessel.
At least they aren't Cultists, but you aren't interested in fighting them.

event.name: ORIGINS_DUEL_CHOICE
event.text: You spot two ships squaring off nearby. It appears the first are some Cultists, who eagerly tracked down a Crystal Sentinel only to be attacked!
You engage the cultist vessel.
You engage the Crystalline vessel.
You prepare to jump away as soon as possible before you get caught in the battle.

event.name: CULTIST_BOUNTY
event.text: You receive a hail from a nearby cultist vessel. They seem to have some sort of job for you.

"Hello, stranger. I have a request for you. We are in the middle of a search for an Ember Spirit, and we suspect one might be hiding nearby. However, our ship is not armed well enough to capture them. Will you assist us?"
You follow the co-ordinates given by the Cultists which leads you to a small asteroid field with a Crystalline Sentinel hiding inside!
You ignore the cultists.
The Cultist ship doesn't take kindly to being ignored, and attack!

event.name: CULTIST_FAKE
event.text: A strange, green cultist ship with a modified logo is preaching to several other cultist ships. "Come brothers, do not believe Grand Priest Vortigon's lies! Come join me, and drink the ceremonial and definitely not poisoned space-juice!"

choice.text: These poor souls have no idea what they're getting themselves into. Rescue them!

event.text: You power up the weapons and attack the crazy cultist ship.

choice.text: These people can do whatever they want, it's their life.

event.text: You distance yourself from the insane cultists.

event.name: CULTIST_FAKE_WIN
event.text: You've defeated the Cultists and saved the other ships. You scrap the remains.

The other cultists are confused and afraid. One individual, who seems to understand the situation, thanks you. "You must be truly enlightened to have seen through his convincing lies! I wish to come with you."

choice.text: (Vortigon) Halt! This vessel has permission from the Grand Priest to travel here.

event.text: The Cultists pause, and quickly apologize. Terrified of Vortigon's wrath, they hand over some supplies and beg for forgiveness.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_CULTIST
textList.text: Not that you expected a warm welcome from the cultists, but the ships here seem particularly aggressive. Perhaps their religion requires them to be rude...
"You are not true believers, your presence here insults the Ember spirits! Die die die!"
A hostile Cultist ship is here, their insane captain drooling at the prospect of killing you. These guys really are freaks.
An Ember vessel is drifting nearby the skeletons of some poor tourist vessels. At the very moment they notice you it seems they're set on destroying you next!
It appears a fight is inevitable as a Cultist vessel moves in to attack.
You never could have guessed at how many ships these cultists would have in reserve. Oh well, at least it means there's no shortage of scrap for the taking either.
"The Grand Priest has not sanctioned your presence here! You are not worthy of being in the presence of the Ember spirits!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ORIGINS_CRYSTAL
textList.text: A Crystalline ship is moving about this beacon. You know there's an issue when you're seeing more cultists than Crystals in what should have been Crystalline territory, but you don't have time to ponder that though any longer until the Crystal ship turns aggressive.

It seems the original population of Crystalline people of this sector have been on edge since the invasion of cultists. So much so that the ship here attacks you on sight without so much as a second thought!
"You are intruding in our sector, Federation! We have enough cultists to deal with, you cannot be here!" You try to reason with the Crystal ship, but they're beyond listening.
A Crystalline ship approaches, weapons drawn. You don't know what you did to anger them, but looks like you'll have to fight.

event.name: CULTIST_PIRATE_BURN
event.text: A Cultist vessel has set a nearby pirate ship ablaze. While the ship burns in the distance, they approach you with intentions of doing the same.

event.name: CULTIST_PIRATE_BURN_SHIP
event.text: Scans pick up very faint life signatures on the pirate vessel. It might not be too late to save them, but it'll be risky.

choice.text: You have no crew to assist, therefore docking is not an option.

event.text: Your crew rush aboard to try and save the pirates. Fortunately, everyone makes it back alive, including one of the survivors.

Your crew rush aboard to try and save the pirates. The team returns with one of the survivors, but one of your crew is missing. The team reports that they were caught in the blaze and didn't make it out alive.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, it'll take more than some flames for the Clone Bay to not bring your crew back.

event.text: It appears the pirates did not make it. Your crew return empty-handed.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_CULTIST_SUN
event.text: "The warmth, can you feel it? Is there no better spectacle to behold than that of a sun before your demise?" You start to nod until you process the last part of their message, but it's already too late. The cultist vessel swoops in to attack.

choice.text: (Vortigon) Halt! This vessel has permission from the Grand Priest to travel here.

event.text: The Cultists pause, and quickly apologize. Terrified of Vortigon's wrath, they hand over some supplies and beg for forgiveness.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ORIGINS_CRYSTAL_ASTEROID
event.text: A Crystalline vessel, likely trying to hide from the insane cultists, has taken refuge in the asteroid field here. They seem to think you're hunting them, because they don't give you any chances and attack as soon as you jump in!
